Detailed Description

Coded Item (behavior for audio file and chart)

Copyright 2013 University of Washington, School of Nursing. http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause

CodedItemBehavior::getStaff ( &$  model,
$  siteId,
$  audio_coding_adjunct = false 
)

Find all staff that should be working with coded items

Parameters:
siteId If not null, return only staff from the given site
audio_coding_adjunct 'adjunct' or 'nonadjunct' or null
Returns:
Staff described, in the usual $this->data format

CodedItemBehavior::countStatuses ( &$  model  )

CodedItemBehavior::getAll ( &$  model,
$  id,
$  adminUser,
$  researchStaff,
$  status,
$  audio_coding_adjunct = false 
)

Get a list of relevant participants who have coded items in a particular state/status

Parameters:
id Id of the authorized user
adminUser True if they are an administrator
researchStaff True if they are research staff
status Current status of the file (but not inclusive, as follows: RAW implies RAW or DOWNLOADED_SCRUB, ASSIGNED_CODING implies ASSIGNED_CODING, CODER1_DONE or CODER2_DONE, CODING_DONE implies CODING_DONE, TO_BE_RECODED, CODER1_DONE or CODER2_DONE)
audio_coding_adjunct false to ignore, 'adjunct', or 'nonadjunct'
Returns:
a list of accessible participants who have coded items in the proper state

CodedItemBehavior::toBeCoded ( &$  model,
$  item,
$  authUserId,
$  recode 
)

Is an item to be coded by a particular staff user?

Parameters:
item Coded item
authUserId Id of the staff user
recode Is the item to be recoded?
Returns:

CodedItemBehavior::canReviewCoding ( &$  model,
$  item,
$  codingNumber,
$  authUserId,
$  adminUser 
)

Can a staff user review a particular coding?

Parameters:
item Coded item
codingNumber 1, 2 or 3 to indicate which coding (3 = recoding)
authUserId Id of the staff user
adminUser Is the staff user an administrator?
Returns:
Whether the item can be reviewed by the staff user.
